intro: Mallotus insularum, commonly known as the Island Mallot, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, green leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is often found in sandy or rocky soils. It has a compact growth habit and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value. Due to its restricted distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
